items.title: Democrats release new Epstein photos ahead of DoJ transparency deadline
items.standfirst: Images, undated and uncaptioned, include Nabokov lines written on woman’s body and show Bill Gates and Noam ChomskyUS politics – live updatesWhat we know so far about the Epstein filesDemocrats on the House oversight committee have released a new batch of photos from the estate of the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as the deadline for the justice department to release its files related to Epstein looms.The images, released on Thursday, are undated and lack captions or context. Among them are photographs of what appear to be lines from Vladimir Nabokov’s novel Lolita written on different parts of a woman’s body. Continue reading...

items.title: Kennedy Center board votes to add Trump’s name to DC arts institution
items.standfirst: Joe Kennedy III, JFK’s grandson, said he doubted the Trump-Kennedy Center name change was legalThe board of the Kennedy Center in Washington DC is moving ahead with a proposal to rename the arts and culture-focused institution, named after President John F Kennedy, in honor of Donald Trump, according to an announcement from the White House on Thursday.If the White House move succeeds it would be called the Trump-Kennedy Center, though it is unclear if this change would be legal. Continue reading...
items.content: Joe Kennedy III, JFK’s grandson, said he doubted the Trump-Kennedy Center name change was legalThe board of the Kennedy Center in Washington DC is moving ahead with a proposal to rename the arts and culture-focused institution, named after President John F Kennedy, in honor of Donald Trump, according to an announcement from the White House on Thursday.If the White House move succeeds it would be called the Trump-Kennedy Center, though it is unclear if this change would be legal. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump’s $1,776 ‘warrior dividend’ repurposed from military housing aid
items.standfirst: President claims bonus the result of tariff revenue but stipend had already been approved in tax-and-spend billWhen Donald Trump promised a one-time $1,776 payment for 1.45 million US military workers to mark the 250th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence during a primetime TV address on Wednesday, he pointed to his favorite source of federal funding.“Because of tariffs,” the US president said, along with his massive tax-and-spending bill, “we are sending every soldier $1,776 – and the checks are already on the way. Nobody deserves it more than our military.” Continue reading...
items.content: President claims bonus the result of tariff revenue but stipend had already been approved in tax-and-spend billWhen Donald Trump promised a one-time $1,776 payment for 1.45 million US military workers to mark the 250th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence during a primetime TV address on Wednesday, he pointed to his favorite source of federal funding.“Because of tariffs,” the US president said, along with his massive tax-and-spending bill, “we are sending every soldier $1,776 – and the checks are already on the way. Nobody deserves it more than our military.” Continue reading...

items.title: Donald Trump mocks former US presidents in White House plaques
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump has affixed partisan plaques to the portraits of all U.S. commanders in chief, himself included, on his Presidential Walk of Fame at the White House, describing Joe Biden as “sleepy,” Barack Obama as “divisive” and Ronald Reagan as a fan of a young Trump. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Ian Reifowitz, Professor of History at SUNY-Empire State University.

items.title: Tren de Aragua mastermind charged in US federal court with racketeering, drug charges
items.standfirst: An alleged leader of Venezuela’s Tren de Aragua gang was charged in New York with racketeering and drug and firearms offences, US officials said on Thursday. Hector Rusthenford Guerrero Flores, 42, whose whereabouts are unknown, faces a $5 million US reward for information leading to his arrest or conviction.
items.content: An alleged leader of Venezuela’s Tren de Aragua gang was charged in New York with racketeering and drug and firearms offences, US officials said on Thursday. Hector Rusthenford Guerrero Flores, 42, whose whereabouts are unknown, faces a $5 million US reward for information leading to his arrest or conviction.

clusters.title: US announces $11 billion arms package for Taiwan, largest ever
clusters.neutral_headline: US announces more than $10bn of arms sales to Taiwan

items.title: US announces $11 billion arms package for Taiwan, largest ever
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump's administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10 billion that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis speaks with Rex Li, Professor of International Relations at King's College London.
items.content: President Donald Trump's administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10 billion that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis speaks with Rex Li, Professor of International Relations at King's College London.

items.title: US announces more than $10bn of arms sales to Taiwan
items.standfirst: Package includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, and has drawn an angry response from ChinaThe maps that show how China’s military is squeezing TaiwanThe Trump administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10bn that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China.The state department announced the sales late on Wednesday during a nationally televised address by president Donald Trump, who made scant mention of foreign policy issues and did not speak about China or Taiwan at all. US-Chinese tensions have ebbed and flowed during Trump’s second term, largely over trade and tariffs but also over China’s increasing aggressiveness toward Taiwan, which Beijing has said must unify with the People’s Republic of China. Continue reading...
items.content: Package includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, and has drawn an angry response from ChinaThe maps that show how China’s military is squeezing TaiwanThe Trump administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10bn that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China.The state department announced the sales late on Wednesday during a nationally televised address by president Donald Trump, who made scant mention of foreign policy issues and did not speak about China or Taiwan at all. US-Chinese tensions have ebbed and flowed during Trump’s second term, largely over trade and tariffs but also over China’s increasing aggressiveness toward Taiwan, which Beijing has said must unify with the People’s Republic of China. Continue reading...

clusters.title: As Netflix, Paramount Battle Over Warner Bros., What’s at Stake?
clusters.neutral_headline: As Netflix, Paramount Battle Over Warner Bros., What’s at Stake

items.title: As Netflix, Paramount Battle Over Warner Bros., What’s at Stake?
items.standfirst: Who ends up with the assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., the owner of one of Hollywood’s largest and most venerable film studios, is likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades to come. On Dec. 5, the company announced that Netflix Inc., the world’s dominant streaming platform, had agreed to purchase its streaming and studio assets in a $82.7 billion deal, including debt. Three days later, Paramount Skydance Corp. launched a hostile takeover bid for all of Warner Bros. The offer v
items.content: Who ends up with the assets of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., the owner of one of Hollywood’s largest and most venerable film studios, is likely to impact the entertainment industry for decades to come. On Dec. 5, the company announced that Netflix Inc., the world’s dominant streaming platform, had agreed to purchase its streaming and studio assets in a $82.7 billion deal, including debt. Three days later, Paramount Skydance Corp. launched a hostile takeover bid for all of Warner Bros. The offer v

items.title: Warner Bros Discovery urges shareholders to reject Paramount’s $108.4bn takeover bid
items.standfirst: After WBD accused Paramount of misleading investors, the network assured it had ‘all necessary financing’ for the dealWarner Bros Discovery has urged shareholders to reject a $108.4bn hostile takeover offer from Paramount Skydance, branding it “inadequate” amid an extraordinary corporate battle to control the legacy media conglomerate.WBD agreed to sell its storied movie studios, HBO cable network and streaming service to Netflix in a $82.7bn deal earlier this month, setting the stage for a seismic shift in Hollywood’s industrial landscape.This article was amended on 17 December 2025 to include comment from Paramount and its chair, David Ellison Continue reading...
items.content: After WBD accused Paramount of misleading investors, the network assured it had ‘all necessary financing’ for the dealWarner Bros Discovery has urged shareholders to reject a $108.4bn hostile takeover offer from Paramount Skydance, branding it “inadequate” amid an extraordinary corporate battle to control the legacy media conglomerate.WBD agreed to sell its storied movie studios, HBO cable network and streaming service to Netflix in a $82.7bn deal earlier this month, setting the stage for a seismic shift in Hollywood’s industrial landscape.This article was amended on 17 December 2025 to include comment from Paramount and its chair, David Ellison Continue reading...

The Labor Department reported Thursday that its consumer price index rose 2.7% in November from a year earlier. Yet,…
items.content: At a time when Americans are frustrated and angry over the high cost of living, the government released a report Thursday showing that inflation had cooled unexpectedly in November. The Labor Department reported Thursday that its consumer price index rose 2.7% in November from a year earlier. Yet,…

items.title: Inflation cools slightly in November as worries about affordability grip Americans
items.standfirst: The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase than for the 12 months ending in September.
items.content: The cost of living in November was up 2.7% from a year ago, according to a report Thursday from the Labor Department. That's a smaller annual increase than for the 12 months ending in September.(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)

clusters.title: Tech Billionaires Back $1 Billion for CERN’s Next Physics Breakthrough
clusters.neutral_headline: Tech Billionaires Back $1 Billion for CERN’s Next Physics Breakthrough

items.title: Tech Billionaires Back $1 Billion for CERN’s Next Physics Breakthrough
Tech Billionaires Back $1 Billion for CERN’s Next Physics Breakthrough
items.standfirst: Some of the wealthiest individuals in technology including Eric Schmidt and France’s Xavier Niel have pledged as much as €860 million ($1 billion) to CERN to fund a proposed successor to the Large Hadron Collider, as the storied research institute turns to private backers for the first time to back future breakthroughs.
items.content: Some of the wealthiest individuals in technology including Eric Schmidt and France’s Xavier Niel have pledged as much as €860 million ($1 billion) to CERN to fund a proposed successor to the Large Hadron Collider, as the storied research institute turns to private backers for the first time to back future breakthroughs.

items.title: Airbnb’s NYC Comeback Dashed After Bill Easing Restrictions Dies
Airbnb’s NYC Comeback Dashed After Bill Easing Restrictions Dies
items.standfirst: An Airbnb Inc.-backed bill that would have eased some short-term rental restrictions in New York City failed to make local legislators’ final voting agenda of the year, dealing another setback to the company’s efforts to regain traction in one of the busiest tourism markets in the US.
items.content: An Airbnb Inc.-backed bill that would have eased some short-term rental restrictions in New York City failed to make local legislators’ final voting agenda of the year, dealing another setback to the company’s efforts to regain traction in one of the busiest tourism markets in the US.

clusters.title: Trump administration imposes sanctions on two more ICC judges for investigating Israel
clusters.neutral_headline: US sanctions more ICC judges, citing ruling on Israeli war crime probe

items.title: Trump administration imposes sanctions on two more ICC judges for investigating Israel
items.standfirst: The International Criminal Court slammed a "flagrant attack" on its independence on Thursday after the United States imposed sanctions on two more judges over their role in investigating Israeli officials for possible war crimes in Gaza. Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who faces an ICC arrest warrant, praised Washington for its "strong action" against the court.
items.content: The International Criminal Court slammed a "flagrant attack" on its independence on Thursday after the United States imposed sanctions on two more judges over their role in investigating Israeli officials for possible war crimes in Gaza. Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who faces an ICC arrest warrant, praised Washington for its "strong action" against the court.

items.title: US sanctions more ICC judges, citing ruling on Israeli war crime probe
items.standfirst: International court has repeatedly decried US sanctions amid its ongoing investigation into Gaza war crimes.
items.content: International court has repeatedly decried US sanctions amid its ongoing investigation into Gaza war crimes.

items.title: M23 says started withdrawing troops from key DR Congo city
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition, Rwandan-backed M23 rebels say they have begun pulling out from the strategic town of Uvira in eastern DRC. Also, 11 detained Nigerian Air Force personnel have been released in Burkina Faso. And Sudanese football finds an unexpected new home in Rwanda.
items.content: In tonight's edition, Rwandan-backed M23 rebels say they have begun pulling out from the strategic town of Uvira in eastern DRC. Also, 11 detained Nigerian Air Force personnel have been released in Burkina Faso. And Sudanese football finds an unexpected new home in Rwanda.

items.content: The air force personnel have been released but have not yet returned home, Nigeria says.

items.content: Critics warn that the Trump administration's statements against transgender healthcare contradict decades of research.

items.title: RFK Jr. and Dr. Oz announce moves to ban gender-affirming care for young people
items.standfirst: The Trump administration Thursday proposed two rules targeting hospitals that treat transgender children and youth using Medicare and Medicaid as the lever. The move would affect trans youth who have private insurance, too.
items.content: The Trump administration Thursday proposed two rules targeting hospitals that treat transgender children and youth using Medicare and Medicaid as the lever. The move would affect trans youth who have private insurance, too.(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

items.content: The prosecution accused Frederic Pechier of having 'used medicine to kill' at least 12 people.

items.title: France's 'Doctor Death' jailed for life for killing 12 patients
items.standfirst: A former anaesthetist dubbed "Doctor Death" by French prosecutors has been sentenced to at least 22 years in prison for killing 12 people.
items.content: A former anaesthetist dubbed "Doctor Death" by French prosecutors has been sentenced to at least 22 years in prison for killing 12 people.

clusters.title: US strike on alleged drug boat in Pacific kills four, as Trump accuses Venezuela of taking ‘our oil’
clusters.neutral_headline: U.S. military announces another strike on suspected drug boat that killed 4

items.title: US strike on alleged drug boat in Pacific kills four, as Trump accuses Venezuela of taking ‘our oil’
items.standfirst: Hegseth announcement comes day after Trump blockades all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving VenezuelaThe US military carried out a lethal strike on a vessel it said was engaged in drug trafficking in the eastern Pacific, according to the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, as Trump further ratcheted up pressure on Venezuela, accusing the country of taking US oil.On Wednesday Hegseth said the “lethal kinetic strike” on a vessel engaged in “narco-trafficking operations” had killed four people. The latest strike in the Pacific brings the death toll to 99 since the US began its campaign of striking alleged drug-trafficking boats in September. Continue reading...
items.content: Hegseth announcement comes day after Trump blockades all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving VenezuelaThe US military carried out a lethal strike on a vessel it said was engaged in drug trafficking in the eastern Pacific, according to the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, as Trump further ratcheted up pressure on Venezuela, accusing the country of taking US oil.On Wednesday Hegseth said the “lethal kinetic strike” on a vessel engaged in “narco-trafficking operations” had killed four people. The latest strike in the Pacific brings the death toll to 99 since the US began its campaign of striking alleged drug-trafficking boats in September. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. military announces another strike on suspected drug boat that killed 4
items.standfirst: A U.S. military strike killed four people on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the eastern Pacific, defense officials said Wednesday
items.content: A U.S. military strike killed four people on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the eastern Pacific, defense officials said Wednesday
